title: The cost price of 19 articles is equal to the selling price of 16 articles. What is the gain percent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the cost price of each article be X Cost price of 19 articles = 19X = Sale price of 16 articles Cost price of 16 articles = 16X So profit on 16 articles = 19X - 16X = 3X So % profit = ( 3X / 16X ) x 100 = 18.75 %

When a question is asking about a percent and the starting number is not given, you need not worry about the starting number. Let’s assume that the CP of each article be $1. Thus, CP of 19 articles will be $19. SP of 16 articles = CP of 19 articles = $19 => SP of 1 article = $19/16 Gain % = ](SP - CP)/CP]*100% = [(19/16 - 1)/1]*100% = 18.75% Hope this helps! :)
